title: How has the proportion of inpatients warned about medication side effects to watch for on discharge changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of inpatients who reported not being warned about potential medication side effects has decreased steadily from 45% of surveyed patients in 2009 to 42% in 2013. However, in the latest year of data, 61% of patients were not completely told about medication side effects to watch out for when they went home and is an area for potential improvement.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients
